tier.description: The Stationmaster has asked to speak to you in Agartha.

dialog.line: Good day. Is there something I can...
Ah... it's you. You have arrived. I am most grateful for your punctuality.
I am in need of your assistance on something of a personal matter.
I assure you it is of utmost importance. Utmost importance, indeed.
For if we don't address those matters that are most personal...
If we don't hold close those things that are most dear...
Er, uhm... Pardon me, I will prattle on for ages if permitted.
Allow me to get straight to the point...
From time to time, I look in on a certain special young lady.
Not personally, of course. It has been many years since I've been topside.
I rely on the eyes and ears of others to keep me informed.
It has been reported to me that she... Luella... is in distress.
The young have such tender hearts, but I am assured this is no fleeting matter.
At times like these the burden of duty weighs heavy, but I must attend my post.
Would you be so kind as to pay her a visit in my stead?
Luella tends bar in London. You will likely find her there.
Hello, love. What'll ya have?

tier.itemName: Lengstereisen,Myrrh Ale,Mercurius,Uisge Beatha,Brewed Ergot,Silver Twilight,Ergot & Orange,Londinium Mint,Azadi Blonde,Azadi Red,Misha & Cola, Azadi Brown,Misha & Cranberry,St. Swithin's,Bingo! Cola,Misha Black

dialog.line: Here ya go.
Now love, tell me your problems, so I can forget about mine.
No problems, then? I wish I could say the same.
It's my boyfriend, Geoffrey. He's gone and got himself in a bit of trouble.
He fancies himself a reporter, writin' on his blog that nary a soul reads.
He's always on about 'conspiracy theory this' and 'supernatural that'.
It's all a load of bollocks I tell him, but he doesn't listen.
Before you know it, he's off on one of his grand investigations without a moments notice.
This time he's gone clear across the pond! Something about a small coastal town.
The way he tells it there are 'extraordinary events' happening there.
They've got the place locked down, but he was determined to get in.
Oh, he got in alright, but I haven't heard from him since.
He was supposed to be back weeks ago, but not a word!
That Geoffrey is a pain in my arse, I tell you...
...but I love him.
These creatures... these abnormalities that surround us...
I often wonder, as they rush towards human flesh to satisfy that which is insatiable...
Is there any fraction of their former selves that remains?
Any remnant that turns away in disgust as they are compelled to dine?
And what of the rest of us? We hunger. We lust.
Yet, there are those who resist.
Perhaps that is why some did not answer the call out to sea.
Perhaps that is why some will not rise from their graves.
Perhaps... that is why WE survive.
Resistance is NOT futile.
Take this young man, for instance.
Geoffrey Richardson of London, England, according to his identification.
He has clearly been wounded and infected by one of these creatures,
yet his body resists the transformation.
Under the microscope, I can see the war that rages within his cells,
but it is a mystery to me how he endures.
Samples of the surrounding 'wildlife' could provide some exposition.
At last, some samples to inspect! I will return shortly.
I appreciate your efforts, but I'm afraid these samples have not been very helpful.
They are not unlike examining a lifeless mound of dirt.
It appears to me that the attacking cells are more acquatic or amphibian in nature.

tier.targetName: Draug Warmonger,Feigr Impaler,Drowned Mariner,Incubator,Feigr Mauler,Drowned Mariner Carrier,Feigr Broodwitch,Feigr Seacaller,Feigr Lord

dialog.line: Ah, more samples, I see. Please remain with the patient until I return.
Now, we are getting somewhere. These samples are very similar.
If anything, I'd say the strain inside this young man is even more vicious than those you collected.
I will continue to investigate...
Geoffrey: Loo...
Doctor: There, there, young man. You need to rest.
Geoffrey: Loo...
Doctor: Lutefisk? This man is clearly delirious. No one would request such a rancid dish.
Sheriff: 'Lutefisk', heh, heh.
Doctor: Ellen, do you have something to add?
It's funny. There are some words you come across only a few times in a lifetime,
but they have a way of sticking with you.
'Lutefisk'. Now there's a word you don't hear everyday.
The last time I heard it was a couple of years ago.
The youths liked to have their parties on an island off the coast of Journey's End.
I was young once. I know what goes on out there.
One of the girls shows up here in the middle of the night, as white as a sheet.
She went on and on about 'Lutefisk' and sea monsters, before I finally calmed her down.
Old Larry Creed - God rest his soul - used to tell stories that wound the kids up.
Mix substance abuse with a little imagination, and you can predict the results.
'Don't do drugs, kids. There's no such thing as sea monsters.'
That's what I used to say...
Larry used to love telling sea stories. I remember them all.
He'd have the men and their families over, and everyone would gather around after supper.
'It was a grand voyage across treacherous seas...'
That's how he'd start all his stories, in his best seamen's voice.
'...a grand voyage across treacherous seas, when suddenly the winds died down and the waters calmed.'
'It was peaceful, the sky reflecting off the glassy surface...'
'until a thick fog rolled in and brought with it a foul stench.'
'The men began to gag and cough, covering their noses while looking for the source of the smell,'
'except for a Norwegian mate who uttered one word:'
'No sooner had he got the word out of his mouth, than he was pulled over by a giant tentacle.'
'One by one the other men suffered the same fate,'
'save for one young man, huddled in the middle of the boat in his own desperation,'
'praying to his god that he might live another day.'
'He could hear the others screaming and drowning, but he remained hidden, praying.'
'After an eternity... the screams stopped.'
'The boat stopped rocking.'
'The fog receded.'
'The man had been spared, rewarded with an immediate field promotion to captain, on account of the virtues of fear and cowardice.'
'So, if you ever see a fog roll in accompanied by a foul stench...'
'you don't cover your nose.'
'You don't look overboard.'
'And you sure as hell don't say 'Lutefisk'!'
'You run. You hide. You pray.'
'Or else the Lutefisk monster will take your very life!'
It was about then that the others realized Larry had let out a foul stench of his own, ha!
He'd laugh hard for a bit, then he'd get quiet and just stare off into space, lost in a memory, I suppose.
If I didn't know better, I'd say that was fear in his eyes.

tier.description: Kill Lutefisk and gather a sample.
Return to the doctor with the sample.

dialog.line: Another sample? Very well, I will return shortly.
Remarkable! This is an exact match for the strain.
It immediately overwhelms every human cell I test. It is absolutely vicious!
How this young man can resist is extraordinary! I must continue...
Geoffrey: Huh...
Doctor: Honey? That's certainly preferable to lutefisk, but I'm afraid we're all out.
Obviously, he is still delirious, but I will continue my research.
Doctor: What are you doing? What is that you're giving him? Hold on just a...
Geoffrey: Uhhh...
Doctor: Oh! He's waking up.
Geoffrey: My head... Where am I?
Doctor: You've suffered a serious injury, young man.
Geoffrey: Oh... the Illuminati, the monsters, the magic honey...
I can't believe it. Everything is... Luella!
Doctor: Hold on there! You're not ready to get up just yet. You need more rest.
Geoffrey: Yes, of course... but Luella. She must be worried sick.
Please, I must write a letter, then I will rest.
Doctor: Very well, but be brief.
Geoffrey: Thank you. You have been very kind to me. If I could impose on you once more...
Please make sure this letter is delivered to my girlfriend in London. She must know that I am safe.
Welcome back, love... What's this?
It's a letter from Geoffrey. How did you...?
Oh my! He's alive! Geoffrey's alive!
And he's coming home!
Oh, I could just kiss you! But I have a boyfriend! A real live...
Oh, sod it!
Mmmm... tastes like honey.
I could get used to that. I'd better not have more.
My Geoffrey will be home soon.
Know that I am truly grateful. From the bottom of my heart...
Thank you.
I see that everything has been set aright once again.
Eyes and ears, you know.
Ah, young love... it is both inspiring and nostalgia inducing.
Those days are long past for me, but there was a time...
I found love, a wife, children. A family.
Grandchildren eventually, and so on, and so on...
Of course, my descendants wouldn't understand all of... this.
Regrettably, I must remain undisclosed to those I watch over,
a surreptitious benefactor in times of need.
Your kind assistance has been essential in this endeavor.
You have my eternal gratitude.
